member.summary: Gets whether the current item has children within the containing hierarchical collection. This is based on a dependency property.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current item is considered as a leaf within the containing hierarchical collection.

member.summary: Iterates all level parent items of the current item up in the hierarchical collection.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.GetNextWorkingTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time, determined based on the working week and working day definitions, excluding the defined nonworking time intervals.

member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time.

Optionally, a schedule object to use instead of the default working and nonworking time intervals.
member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.GetPreviousWorkingTime(System.DateTime)

member.param: The date and time to get the previous working time for.

member.returns: The maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.GetNextVisibleTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart, determined based on the visible week and visible day definitions. If the resulting date and time cannot be less than TimelinePageFinish, then TimelinePageFinish is returned.
member.param: The date and time to get the next visible time for.
member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.GetPreviousVisibleTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart, determined based on the visible week and visible day definitions. If the resulting date and time cannot be greater than TimelinePageStart, then TimelinePageStart is returned.
member.param: The date and time to get the previous visible time for.
member.returns: The maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.GetNextNonworkingTime(System.DateTime)

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.GetAssignments(DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartItem)
member.summary: Iterates the list of assignments (defined as resource names and associated allocation units) from a specific task within the control. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task item is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"), or, in case of a Schedule Chart, formatted as an optional allocation percent (e.g.: "12.5%").
member.param: The task item to get the assignments of.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.LevelResources
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied starting from the current date and time, and without considering already started tasks. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.LevelResources(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied starting from the current date and time. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.
member.param: A value indicating whether or not to consider already started tasks (i.e. having completion > 0) for resource leveling.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.LevelResources(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied without considering already started tasks. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.
member.param: The start date and time to consider for resource leveling algorithm.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.LevelResources(System.Boolean,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.
member.param: A value indicating whether or not to consider already started tasks (i.e. having completion > 0) for resource leveling.
The start date and time to consider for resource leveling algorithm.

member.summary: Gets or sets the template to be used for displaying dependency lines in the chart (by default arrow polylines drawn for each predecessor item from the appropriate end of the other task bar to the appropriate end of the corresponding dependent task bar, based on the dependency type).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.ToolTipTemplate

member.summary: Gets or sets the template to be used for displaying the content of dependency line tool tips (by default the Content property values of the other and dependent task items separated by a dash, when IsDependencyToolTipVisible is true).

member.summary: Gets or sets the task bar height of any item presented in the chart.

member.summary: Occurs when timeline page changes in the view.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum day of week that is visible in the chart (by default, Sunday).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.VisibleWeekFinish
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum day of week that is visible in the chart (by default, Saturday).

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum time of day that is visible in the chart (by default, 8:00 AM).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.VisibleDayFinish
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time of day that is visible in the chart (by default, 4:00 PM).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.WorkingWeekStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum day of week that is considered as a working day in the chart (by default, Monday).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.WorkingWeekFinish
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum day of week that is considered as a working day in the chart (by default, Friday).

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum time of day that is considered as a working time in the chart (by default, 8:00 AM).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.WorkingDayFinish
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time of day that is considered as a working time in the chart (by default, 4:00 PM).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.NonworkingIntervals
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of time intervals that are to be considered as special nonworking time (such as holidays or or other type of break time) in the chart.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.NonworkingDayIntervalProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets a method used to retreive supplemental nonworking day time intervals to be considered in the chart for any specific date passed in as the method parameter.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.HourWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of one hour of the timeline of the chart (controlling the horizontal zoom of the chart content).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.DisplayedTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time to be displayed at the most left visible horizontal position in the viewport of the internal scroll viewer of the control (the minimum date and time that is visible at the current horizontal scroll position).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.Scales
member.summary: Gets the collection of scale objects, representing items to be used as header elements in the chart (by default a major scale of type Weeks, and a minor scale Days are included).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.UpdateScaleInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the time interval that should be used for rounding the timing property values when drag and drop operations are used to modify task items in the chart (by default 15 minutes).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.IGanttChartView.AreIndividualItemHeightsApplied
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to consider individual GanttChartItem.ItemHeight property values (instead of only the main ItemHeight property value of the control) when computing item positions and sizes (false by default).

member.summary: Occurs when a data property value of an item within the control changes.

member.summary: Occurs when the data item collection within the control changes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the specific hour cost values to apply for the assigned resources of the managed tasks.

member.summary: Gets or sets the resource schedules (working and nonworking time definitions) to consider when scheduling items with assigned resources (considering the resource with the maximum assigned allocation units value for each item, and assuming they do not have specific schedules defined themselves).

member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.GetNextVisibleTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart, determined based on the visible week and visible day definitions. If the resulting date and time cannot be less than TimelinePageFinish, then TimelinePageFinish is returned.
member.param: The date and time to get the next visible time for.
member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.GetPreviousVisibleTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart, determined based on the visible week and visible day definitions. If the resulting date and time cannot be greater than TimelinePageStart, then TimelinePageStart is returned.
member.param: The date and time to get the previous visible time for.
member.returns: The maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.GetNextVisibleWorkingTime(System.DateTime)

member.param: The date and time to get the next visible working time for.
member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart and considered as a working time.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.GetPreviousVisibleWorkingTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart and considered as a working time, determined based on the visible week and visible day definitions, and working week and working day definitions, excluding the defined nonworking time intervals. member.param: The date and time to get the previous visible working time for.

member.summary: Iterates the list of assignments (defined as resource names and associated allocation units) from a specific task within the control. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task item is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"), or, in case of a Schedule Chart, formatted as an optional allocation percent (e.g.: "12.5%").
member.param: The task item to get the assignments of.

member.param: The task item to get the assignments of.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.GetAssignments(System.String)

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.GetAssignedItems(System.String)
member.summary: Iterates the list of standard task assignments (defined as task items) for a specific resource within the control. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"), or, in case of a Schedule Chart, formatted as an optional allocation percent (e.g.: "12.5%").
member.param: The resource name to get the assignments of.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.GetAssignedResources
member.summary: Iterates the list of assigned resources (unique entries) from all standard tasks within the control. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"), or, in case of a Schedule Chart, formatted as an optional allocation percent (e.g.: "12.5%").

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.AddAssignment(DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartItem,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified resource as an assignment to the AssignmentsContent property value of a specific task in the control. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]").
member.param: The task item to add the assignment to.
The resource name to add as an assignment.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.AddAssignment(DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartItem,System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.Double})
member.summary: Adds the specified assignment (identified as a pair of resource name and allocation units) to the AssignmentsContent property value of a specific task in the control. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]").
member.param: The task item to add the assignment to.
The assignment to add.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.RemoveAssignment(DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartItem,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified resource assignment from the AssignmentsContent property value of a specific task in the control. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]").
member.param: The task item to remove the assignment from.
The resource name of the assignment to remove.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.SplitRemainingWork(DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartItem,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates and inserts a partial copy of the specified task item considering its remaining work effort into the managed hierarchy, and updates the finish date and time of the original task item to its completion point. Used as preparation for rescheduling the remaining work effort of a task item.
member.param: The item to split.
The suffix to apply to the Content property value for the new remaining work item.
The suffix to apply to the Content property value for the original item.
member.returns: The new remaining work item that can be rescheduled as needed.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.SplitAllRemainingWork(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates and inserts partial copies of the standard started task items that have not yet been fully completed considering their remaining work effort into the managed hierarchy, and updates the finish date and times of the original task items to their completion points. Used as preparation for rescheduling the remaining work effort task items, such as before calling the method.
member.param: The suffix to apply to the Content property value for the new remaining work items.
The suffix to apply to the Content property value for the original items.
member.returns: The new remaining work items that can be rescheduled as needed.

member.summary: Optimizes schedule times of the specified item in order to optimize the project finish date without leveling resources, respecting dependency constraints.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.OptimizeWork(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Optimizes schedule times of all managed items in order to optimize the project finish date without leveling resources, respecting dependency constraints.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.LevelAllocations(DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartItem[])
member.summary: Levels the assigned allocation units assuming that all or the specified tasks within the control are fixed duration and effort driven. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having weight allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]").

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.LevelResources
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied starting from the current date and time, and without considering already started tasks. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.LevelResources(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied starting from the current date and time. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.
member.param: A value indicating whether or not to consider already started tasks (i.e. having completion > 0) for resource leveling.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.LevelResources(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied without considering already started tasks. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.
member.param: The start date and time to consider for resource leveling algorithm.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.LevelResources(System.Boolean,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.
member.param: A value indicating whether or not to consider already started tasks (i.e. having completion > 0) for resource leveling.
The start date and time to consider for resource leveling algorithm.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the end user may use drag and drop operations to update task start only, preserving finish date and time value. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.AreMilestonesFinishTimes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether milestones represent finish times in the control. A false value indicates that milestones represent start times, while a null value indicates that milestones are not constrained to start, nor finish times. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.AreCircularDependenciesAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user is allowed to define circular dependencies between task items in the control. At load time not allowing circular dependencies applies (through a RemoveCircularDependencies call) only if asynchronous presentation is disabled. Setting this property will clear the Undo queue. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.AreTaskDependencyConstraintsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether dependency constraints are enabled for items in the control, ensuring that date and times of successor items respect their predecessor settings. Setting this property will clear the Undo queue. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.AreTaskDependencyConstraintsEnabledMaxSteps
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum number of iterations performed in order to ensure dependency constraints by automatically scheduling items in the control, when is set to true. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.AreTaskDependencyConstraintsDisabledWhileDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether dependency constraints are disabled while dragging operations occur, in order to improve performance when is set to true. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.IsUndoEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether undo support is enabled within the control (false by default). When set to true, actions performed on GanttChartItem objects within the control (either by the end user in the user interface or by code behind) are recorded to a queue and can later be undone by calling the method. These actions are recorded to the undo queue and can be undone: managed property value changes (, , , , , , , , , , , , and custom properties for which method is called when their values change), additions and removals within collections, additions and removals in the collection (for Gantt Chart controls) or in the collections (for Schedule Chart controls), and additions and removals in the collection (for Schedule Chart controls). This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.UndoLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of actions stored in the undo queue. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.UndoLinkingTimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time interval to consider between subsequent internal operations in order to determine the end user action boundaries when performing undo and redo operations. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.UndoQueueCount
member.summary: Gets the number of recorded actions in the undo queue.

member.name: E:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.UndoQueueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the undo queue changes, and therefore CanUndo and CanRedo methods may return updated values.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the item at the specified index in the collection.
member.param: The index to get the item at.
member.returns: The item at the specified index in the collection.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.IsScheduleCachingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether specific schedule based timing values that are computed for any task item are internally cached so that if the same computation is required the value could be obtained without further processing (cache is disabled by default, and enabling it may result in high memory usages, until you call ClearCaches method).

member.summary: Occurs for the header that is to be serialized during a Copy operation.

member.name: E:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.CopyingItem
member.summary: Occurs for each item that is to be serialized during a Copy operation.

member.summary: Occurs for each new item that is to be created during a Paste operation.

member.name: E:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.PastedItem
member.summary: Occurs for each new item that has been created during a Paste operation.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.PredecessorsStringDependencyTypeAbbreviations
member.summary: Optionally gets or sets dependency type abbreviations to use upon and calls.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.PredecessorsStringLagFormat
member.summary: Optionally gets or sets lag format to use upon and calls. The value may be of this form: {StringFormat}[{Scale}]. For example, 0.## for hours, or 0.##/8 for working days of 8 hours.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.PredecessorsStringLagScale
member.summary: Optionally gets or sets lag scale to use upon and calls. The value indicates the number of hours of a time unit to use. For example, 8 means a working day of 8 hours.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default usage cost value to apply for the assigned resources of the managed tasks.

member.summary: Gets or sets the specific usage cost values to apply for the assigned resources of the managed tasks.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default hour cost value to apply for the assigned resources of the managed tasks.

member.summary: Gets or sets the resource schedules (working and nonworking time definitions) to consider when scheduling items with assigned resources (considering the resource with the maximum assigned allocation units value for each item, and assuming they do not have specific schedules defined themselves).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartDataGrid.AssignableResources
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of assignable resources that may be set as the items source of an assignment selector control instance. This collection is considered by method; if it is set to null, the method computes the assignable resources based on task assignment definitions. The default value is null. This is a dependency property.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.GetNextWorkingTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time, determined based on the working week and working day definitions, excluding the defined nonworking time intervals.
member.param: The date and time to get the next working time for.
member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.GetNextWorkingTime(System.DateTime,DlhSoft.Windows.Data.Schedule)
member.summary: Gets the minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time, determined based on the working week and working day definitions, excluding the defined nonworking time intervals.
member.param: The date and time to get the next working time for.
Optionally, a schedule object to use instead of the default working and nonworking time intervals.
member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.GetPreviousWorkingTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time, determined based on the working week and working day definitions, excluding the defined nonworking time intervals.
member.param: The date and time to get the previous working time for.
member.returns: The maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.GetPreviousWorkingTime(System.DateTime,DlhSoft.Windows.Data.Schedule)
member.summary: Gets the maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time, determined based on the working week and working day definitions, excluding the defined nonworking time intervals.
member.param: The date and time to get the previous working time for.
Optionally, a schedule object to use instead of the default working and nonworking time intervals.
member.returns: The maximum date and time less or equal than the specified date and time that is considered as a working time.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.GetNextVisibleTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart, determined based on the visible week and visible day definitions. If the resulting date and time cannot be less than TimelinePageFinish, then TimelinePageFinish is returned.
member.param: The date and time to get the next visible time for.
member.returns: The minimum date and time greater or equal than the specified date and time that is visible in the chart.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.GetPreviousVisibleTime(System.DateTime)

member.summary: Iterates the list of assignments (defined as resource names and associated allocation units) from a specific task within the control. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task item is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"), or, in case of a Schedule Chart, formatted as an optional allocation percent (e.g.: "12.5%").
member.param: The task item to get the assignments of.

member.param: The suffix to apply to the Content property value for the new remaining work items.
The suffix to apply to the Content property value for the original items.
member.returns: The new remaining work items that can be rescheduled as needed.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.LevelAllocations(DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartItem[])
member.summary: Levels the assigned allocation units assuming that all or the specified tasks within the control are fixed duration and effort driven. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having weight allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]").

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.LevelResources
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied starting from the current date and time, and without considering already started tasks. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.LevelResources(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied starting from the current date and time. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.
member.param: A value indicating whether or not to consider already started tasks (i.e. having completion > 0) for resource leveling.

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.LevelResources(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Levels the assigned resources from all standard tasks within the control in order to avoid over allocation, by updating task timing values accordingly. Requires that AssignmentsContent property of the task items is of type string, formatted as a list of resource names separated by commas, optionally having associated allocation percents declared between square brackets (e.g.: "John, Mary [50%], Diane [12.5%]"). The resource leveling algorithm is applied without considering already started tasks. Not supported in case of a Schedule Chart.
member.param: The start date and time to consider for resource leveling algorithm.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.IsUndoEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether undo support is enabled within the control (false by default). When set to true, actions performed on GanttChartItem objects within the control (either by the end user in the user interface or by code behind) are recorded to a queue and can later be undone by calling the method. These actions are recorded to the undo queue and can be undone: managed property value changes (, , , , , , , , , , , , and custom properties for which method is called when their values change), additions and removals within collections, additions and removals in the collection (for Gantt Chart controls) or in the collections (for Schedule Chart controls), and additions and removals in the collection (for Schedule Chart controls). This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.UndoLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of actions stored in the undo queue. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.UndoLinkingTimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time interval to consider between subsequent internal operations in order to determine the end user action boundaries when performing undo and redo operations. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.UndoQueueCount
member.summary: Gets the number of recorded actions in the undo queue.

member.name: E:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.UndoQueueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the undo queue changes, and therefore CanUndo and CanRedo methods may return updated values.

member.summary: Gets the item at the specified index in the collection.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether specific schedule based timing values that are computed for any task item are internally cached so that if the same computation is required the value could be obtained without further processing (cache is disabled by default, and enabling it may result in high memory usages, until you call ClearCaches method).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.MaxNonworkingIntervalSearchSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time span to search for nonworking intervals within when using the Get*Nonworking* methods of the Gantt Chart control instances.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.PredecessorsStringDependencyTypeAbbreviations
member.summary: Optionally gets or sets dependency type abbreviations to use upon and calls.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.PredecessorsStringLagFormat
member.summary: Optionally gets or sets lag format to use upon and calls. The value may be of this form: {StringFormat}[{Scale}]. For example, 0.## for hours, or 0.##/8 for working days of 8 hours.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.PredecessorsStringLagScale
member.summary: Optionally gets or sets lag scale to use upon and calls. The value indicates the number of hours of a time unit to use. For example, 8 means a working day of 8 hours.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.GanttChartView.ResourceQuantities
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantity values to consider when leveling resources, indicating maximum amounts of materials available for use at the same time.

member.summary: Gets or sets the initiation cost value to apply to the managed tasks.

member.name: T:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter
member.summary: Converts custom resource items referring custom task items to a collection of ScheduleChartItem objects referring GanttChartItem objects (as required by Items properties of ScheduleChartDataGrid and ScheduleChartView components). Use *Member properties of the converter instance to control which properties of custom items are bound to which ScheduleChartItem and GanttChartItem properties (undefined/null Member values indicate properties that are not bound and default values are automatically generated for these properties on ScheduleChartItem and GanttChartItem objects instead). The converter uses reflection to retreive the appropriate property values from your custom data objects and apply them to the corresponding ScheduleChartItem and GanttChartItem instances. Referred member properties of custom items should be public and accessible for reading and optionally writing (property paths are not supported). Set UpdateSourceOnTargetChanges and/or UpdateTargetOnSourceChanges properties to true/false to indicate the directions of internally managed change updates. Note that UpdateTargetOnSourceChanges works only when the custom data source implements INotifyCollectionChanged interface and/or custom data objects implement INotifyPropertyChanged interface. When UpdateSourceOnTargetChanges is set new objects that need to be created are generated by Activator.CreateInstance internal calls, and therefore they need to provide public access to their parameterless constructor (or their default constructor).

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts custom resource items referring custom task items to a collection of ScheduleChartItem objects referring GanttChartItem objects (as required by Items properties of ScheduleChartDataGrid and ScheduleChartView components).

member.name: M:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Throws a not supported exception as two way conversion is internally implemented and may be configured using the UpdateSourceOnTargetChanges and UpdateTargetOnSourceChanges properties of the converter.

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.ContentMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the property name of custom resource items that Content property of ScheduleChartItem objects should be bound to. Source object values retreived by the custom property may be of any type (including string). This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.AssignedTasksMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the property name of custom resource items that GanttChartItems property of ScheduleChartItem objects should be bound to. Source object values retreived by the custom property need to be of custom task collection type (IEnumerable based). This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.TaskContentMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the property name of custom task items that Content property of GanttChartItem objects should be bound to. Source object values retreived by the custom property may be of any type (including string). This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.TaskStartMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the property name of custom task items that Start property of GanttChartItem objects should be bound to. Source object values retreived by the custom property need to be of date and time type. This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.summary: Gets or sets the property name of custom task items that Finish property of GanttChartItem objects should be bound to. This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.summary: Gets or sets the property name of custom task items that CompletedFinish property of GanttChartItem objects should be bound to. Source object values retreived by the custom property need to be of date and time type. This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.TaskAssignmentsContentMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the property name of custom task items that AssignmentsContent property of GanttChartItem objects should be bound to. Source object values retreived by the custom property may be of any type (including string). This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.UpdateSourceOnTargetChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether data source is automatically updated when target ScheduleChartItem and GanttChartItem objects generated by the converter get their internally bound values changed. Set this property to false when the feature is not needed, e.g. when the user interface is read only (by default it is set to true in order to automatically propagate changes back to the data source as expected in most situations). This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.ResourceItemsConverter.UpdateTargetOnSourceChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether target ScheduleChartItem and GanttChartItem objects generated by the converter are automatically updated when internally bound data source values change. Set this property to true only when the feature is needed, i.e. when code behind changes the data source while the user interface presents it and all changes should be automatically reflected on screen (by default it is set to false in order to provide increased performance). Note that automatic updates work only when the custom data source implements INotifyCollectionChanged interface and/or custom data objects implement INotifyPropertyChanged interface. This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.summary: Gets or sets the property name of custom task items that WbsIndexString property of GanttChartItem objects should be bound to. member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.TaskItemsConverter.UpdateSourceOnTargetChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether data source is automatically updated when target GanttChartItem and PredecessorItem objects generated by the converter get their internally bound values changed. Set this property to false when the feature is not needed, e.g. when the user interface is read only (by default it is set to true in order to automatically propagate changes back to the data source as expected in most situations). This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).

member.name: P:DlhSoft.Windows.Controls.TaskItemsConverter.UpdateTargetOnSourceChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether target GanttChartItem and PredecessorItem objects generated by the converter are automatically updated when internally bound data source values change. Set this property to true only when the feature is needed, i.e. when code behind changes the data source while the user interface presents it and all changes should be automatically reflected on screen (by default it is set to false in order to provide increased performance). Note that automatic updates work only when the custom data source implements INotifyCollectionChanged interface and/or custom data objects implement INotifyPropertyChanged interface. This property can be set only at initialization time (an exception is thrown if it is set after having the conversion process started).
